titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The weather was mild and blustering, not favourable to work. I laboured at the Article, but not at all to my satisfaction. Is it the effect of advancing years that my brain is so reluctant, & my composition so slow and halting? I suffered so much from the tooth ache [sic] that I betook me to the dentist, who patched me up, & arranged to remove the offence on February 1
. Then I looked in at the Edgar Hall, where the Rural Dean was entertaining the children of the Deanery.
